neighbors.name: Hartwood Club
neighbors.claims: The Hartwood Club Inc is a private hunting and fishing club owning extensive forest land in the Town of Deerpark ([mapcarta.com](https://mapcarta.com/W826216244#:~:text=The%20Hartwood%20Club%20Inc)), offering members exclusive outdoor recreation opportunities focused on wildlife and habitat conservation ([www.mapquest.com](https://www.mapquest.com/us/new-york/hartwood-club-inc-355226764#:~:text=https%3A%2F%2Fthehartwoodclub)). (See ORG table for detailed organizational profile.)

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage the club’s leadership privately to address any concerns about habitat and noise, emphasizing that project plans will preserve hunting land and the quiet rural character.

neighbors.name: Richard R. Leonard
neighbors.claims: Public records list Richard R. Leonard as the owner of a large undeveloped tract (tax parcel 15-1-1) in Deerpark ([www.orangecountygov.com](https://www.orangecountygov.com/1153/Property-Tax-Information#:~:text=Parcel%20Information)). There are no apparent mentions of Leonard taking part in local meetings or public debates on development issues.

approach_recommendations.engage: Have a trusted local figure reach out to Mr. Leonard one-on-one to learn his priorities and reassure him the project will respect his property boundaries.

neighbors.name: Mark P. Frizzell
neighbors.claims: Mark P. Frizzell was the owner of a one-acre residential parcel on Hartwood Club Road that sold for $304,000 in July 2025 ([www.zillow.com](https://www.zillow.com/homedetails/45-Hartwood-Club-Rd-Sparrow-Bush-NY-12780/31813418_zpid/#:~:text=Sold%20for%20%24304%2C000%20on%2007%2F22%2F25)). County records also show Frizzell’s name on an adjacent parcel at that location, suggesting a long-term personal residence in the project area ([www.orangecountygov.com](https://www.orangecountygov.com/1153/Property-Tax-Information#:~:text=Parcel%20Information)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Meet with Mr. Frizzell informally (through a mutual acquaintance if possible) to understand any concerns, highlighting measures to maintain local road conditions and property values.

neighbors.name: Cornelius L. Alexy
neighbors.claims: Cornelius L. Alexy purchased a historic 1886 farmhouse property on Hartwood Club Road (approximately 118 acres of land) around 2016 ([www.zillow.com](https://www.zillow.com/homedetails/72-Hartwood-Club-Rd-Sparrow-Bush-NY-12780/31813429_zpid/#:~:text=Skip%20main%20navigation%20Back%20to,62%2Fsqft%20%242%2C881%20Estimated%20rent)) ([www.redfin.com](https://www.redfin.com/NY/Sparrow-Bush/72-Hartwood-Club-Rd-12780/home/54951615#:~:text=Redesign)). Alexy has no recorded involvement in town government or public commentary on development proposals in Deerpark.

approach_recommendations.engage: Approach Mr. Alexy in a neighborly way, possibly via a welcome visit by a community liaison, and emphasize how the project will be mindful of preserving the scenic and historic value of his property.

neighbors.name: Richard L. Stevens II
neighbors.claims: Richard L. Stevens II is identified as the owner of two adjacent residential lots on Hartwood Club Road, including a single-family home (approx. 1,744 sq ft) built in 1989 ([www.zillow.com](https://www.zillow.com/homedetails/39-Hartwood-Club-Rd-Sparrow-Bush-NY-12780/31813420_zpid/#:~:text=%24395%2C100)). There is no public record of Stevens holding any official positions or taking a public stance on local development issues.

approach_recommendations.engage: Have a friendly in-person conversation with Mr. Stevens (or a family contact) to address any questions, focusing on how the project will ensure minimal disruption to daily life and maintain local property values.

neighbors.name: Louis Eichner Jr.
neighbors.claims: Louis Eichner Jr. is listed as the owner of a parcel (Section 13, Block 1, Lot 22) in the Town of Deerpark, according to Orange County’s property records [Orange County Real Property Information Website](https://propertydata.orangecountygov.com). He has no recorded involvement in local boards or public forums on development issues [Town of Deerpark Zoning Board of Appeals](https://townofdeerparkny.gov/?page_id=95).
neighbors.influence_justification: No official role; low public profile

approach_recommendations.engage: A respectful one-on-one outreach is advised. Meet with him personally to introduce the project, address any property-specific concerns, and emphasize that local land use traditions will be respected.

neighbors.name: Ruth Van Putten
neighbors.claims: Ruth Van Putten is identified in public tax records as the owner of parcel 13-1-13 in Deerpark, NY [Orange County Real Property Information Website](https://propertydata.orangecountygov.com). There is no indication that she holds any civic positions or has spoken publicly about development in the town [Town of Deerpark Planning Board](https://townofdeerparkny.gov/?page_id=93).

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage her with a courteous, neighborly approach. An in-person visit or phone call explaining the project in plain terms and assuring minimal disturbance to her daily life would be effective.

neighbors.name: Edgardo Morales
neighbors.claims: Edgardo Morales appears as the listed owner of parcel 13-1-15.11 in Deerpark on the county property rolls [Orange County Real Property Information Website](https://propertydata.orangecountygov.com). He has not been noted in any local municipal committees or press reports related to development matters [Town of Deerpark Zoning Board of Appeals](https://townofdeerparkny.gov/?page_id=95).

approach_recommendations.engage: Approach Mr. Morales with straightforward information about the project’s benefits. A direct contact (letter or call) highlighting how the development will not adversely affect property values or neighborhood safety can help build trust.

neighbors.name: Susan Miiller
neighbors.claims: Susan Miiller is a professional artist and professor who has been on the SUNY New Paltz faculty since 1999 [CREATE Council on the Arts](https://www.createcouncil.org/archives/current-artists-profile-susan-miiller/). She owns the Deerpark parcel 13-1-17 per county land records and is not recorded as active in town government circles [Town of Deerpark Planning Board](https://townofdeerparkny.gov/?page_id=93).
neighbors.influence_justification: No civic role; known mainly in art community

approach_recommendations.engage: Connect with her by acknowledging the area’s natural beauty. Emphasize the project’s design measures to preserve scenic views and environment, which aligns with her appreciation for landscape and nature.

neighbors.name: Patricia Adele Bickford
neighbors.claims: Patricia Adele Bickford is listed as the owner of parcel 13-1-16 in Deerpark on official assessment rolls [Orange County Real Property Information Website](https://propertydata.orangecountygov.com). No public records suggest that she has taken any stance or leadership role regarding local development proposals [Town of Deerpark Zoning Board of Appeals](https://townofdeerparkny.gov/?page_id=95).
neighbors.influence_justification: Not publicly active or in office

approach_recommendations.engage: Outreach should be personable and reassuring. It may help to involve a trusted local figure in communicating how the project will be managed responsibly and will respect the quiet, rural character of the area.

neighbors.name: Anthony D. Risi
neighbors.claims: Anthony D. Risi is the listed owner of a parcel in Deerpark, but no public information on his background or local involvement could be found ([townofdeerparkny.gov](https://townofdeerparkny.gov/?page_id=186#:~:text=Minutes)). No meeting minutes or news reports mention Risi taking any stance on development proposals ([townofdeerparkny.gov](https://townofdeerparkny.gov/?page_id=186#:~:text=Minutes)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Approach with a neighborly, one-on-one conversation to learn any concerns he might have, since his views are not publicly known.

neighbors.name: Edward W. Henderson Jr.
neighbors.claims: Edward W. Henderson Jr. lives in the Sparrowbush area of Deerpark and his family operated a local drywall contracting business for decades ([www.legacy.com](https://www.legacy.com/us/obituaries/njherald/name/edward-henderson-obituary?id=9750677#:~:text=was%20the%20owner%20of%20Ed,his%20wife%2C%20Chandrena%2C%20of%20Franklin)). There is no record of Henderson speaking at town meetings or expressing views on development in any public forum ([www.legacy.com](https://www.legacy.com/us/obituaries/njherald/name/edward-henderson-obituary?id=9750677#:~:text=He%20is%20survived%20by%20his,by%20one%20grandchild%2C%20Matthew%20E)) ([townofdeerparkny.gov](https://townofdeerparkny.gov/?page_id=186#:~:text=Minutes)).
neighbors.influence_justification: Family tradesman; not in public office

approach_recommendations.engage: Have a personal discussion emphasizing project construction details and local economic benefits, aligning with his practical background as a tradesman.

neighbors.name: Darin Strauss
neighbors.claims: Darin Strauss is identified as an owner of parcel 13-1-10 in Deerpark, but no additional personal or civic details are available in public records ([townofdeerparkny.gov](https://townofdeerparkny.gov/?page_id=186#:~:text=Minutes)). Strauss has not been noted in any local meetings or media regarding development issues ([townofdeerparkny.gov](https://townofdeerparkny.gov/?page_id=186#:~:text=Minutes)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage with open questions and provide clear information about the project, as his perspective isn’t publicly known and he has no evident community role.

neighbors.name: Paul F. Farinella
neighbors.claims: Paul F. Farinella owns Deerpark parcel 13-1-20, but there is no public profile or local leadership role associated with his name ([townofdeerparkny.gov](https://townofdeerparkny.gov/?page_id=186#:~:text=Minutes)). No evidence was found of Farinella participating in town meetings or taking a public stance on development ([townofdeerparkny.gov](https://townofdeerparkny.gov/?page_id=186#:~:text=Minutes)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Use a friendly, informational approach to reach out and understand any questions or concerns, since he has maintained a low public profile.

neighbors.name: Edner Carl Narcisse
neighbors.claims: Edner Carl Narcisse is a property owner whose primary work and residence are outside Deerpark (in Spring Valley, NY) ([www.signalhire.com](https://www.signalhire.com/profiles/edner-carl-narcisse%27s-email/205089889#:~:text=Location%3A)). He has no known involvement in Deerpark civic affairs or any stated position on local development matters ([townofdeerparkny.gov](https://townofdeerparkny.gov/?page_id=186#:~:text=Minutes)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Provide updates and point-of-contact information via mail or email, as he resides out of town and may not be actively following local discussions.

neighbors.name: Anthony Dedona
neighbors.claims: Anthony J. Dedona, 88, is listed as the owner of parcel 13-1-6 in Deerpark and is a resident of Maspeth, Queens ([veripages.com](https://veripages.com/name/Anthony/Dedona/#:~:text=Anthony%20Dedona%20Age%2088)) ([veripages.com](https://veripages.com/name/Anthony/Dedona/#:~:text=,Dedona)). He does not appear to reside locally in Orange County and has no known involvement in Deerpark civic affairs (no mentions in town meetings or local news).

approach_recommendations.engage: As an absentee owner, he may be primarily concerned with property value. Outreach should be via written communication emphasizing how the project maintains or enhances local property values.

neighbors.name: Lori Bodine
neighbors.claims: Lori Bodine is the recorded owner of parcel 13-1-15.21 in Deerpark (Orange County) ([townofdeerparkny.gov](https://townofdeerparkny.gov/?p=10318#:~:text=Deerpark%202024%20Tentative%20Tax%20Roll)). There is little public information available about her, and she has not been identified in any local government minutes or news reports reviewed (no public statements on development issues).

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage through standard community outreach (mailers or door-knocking), listening for any personal concerns. Emphasize respect for her property and routine (since no specific issues are known).

neighbors.name: Thomas E. Gumaer III
neighbors.claims: Thomas E. Gumaer III owns parcel 2-1-2 in Deerpark. The Gumaer family is historically significant in Deerpark; early settler Peter E. Gumaer and his descendants were prominent in the community’s history ([www.wgpfoundation.org](https://www.wgpfoundation.org/historic-markers/gumaer-cemetery/#:~:text=Gumaer%20Cemetery%20was%20established%20circa,%E2%80%9D)). No recent records show Thomas III holding an official position or making public comments on local development.
neighbors.influence_justification: Old Deerpark family; longstanding local ties

approach_recommendations.engage: Recognize the Gumaer family’s long legacy in the area and emphasize how the project honors local history and land stewardship. A face-to-face meeting with a community liaison can build trust by acknowledging his family’s roots.

neighbors.name: George Perry
neighbors.claims: George Perry is listed as the owner of parcel 13-1-4.124 in Deerpark (Orange County) ([townofdeerparkny.gov](https://townofdeerparkny.gov/?p=10318#:~:text=Deerpark%202024%20Tentative%20Tax%20Roll)). There is no public record of Perry taking part in local boards or speaking on development issues. His profile in community records is minimal, suggesting he is a private landowner without public civic roles.

approach_recommendations.engage: Use general outreach methods (community meetings, mailed notices) to keep him informed. Since he hasn’t voiced specific concerns publicly, be prepared to address common issues like traffic or noise if he raises them.

neighbors.name: Paul Eliya
neighbors.claims: Paul Eliya, owner of parcel 25-1-1.1, is an information technology professional based in the New York City area ([onug.net](https://onug.net/members/paul-eliya/#:~:text=Staff%20Sales%20Engineer%20)). He appears to be a relatively new property owner in Deerpark and has no recorded history of local civic engagement or public commentary on development proposals. His background implies he is not from a traditional farming family in the town.

approach_recommendations.engage: Approach with a focus on transparency and data (given his tech background). Providing clear, factual information about project impacts (noise levels, technology, etc.) via email or community webinars may resonate.

neighbors.name: Keith G. Campbell
neighbors.claims: Keith G. Campbell is listed as a Deerpark property owner in the town’s 2024 tax roll, but he holds no known public office or committee position [Town of Deerpark](https://townofdeerparkny.gov/?p=10318). As of late 2025, no public statements from Campbell about development or energy projects have been found in local records [Town of Deerpark](https://townofdeerparkny.gov/?p=10318).

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage Mr. Campbell in a personal, respectful visit at his property. Emphasize how the project will preserve the rural character and quiet he values, and offer meaningful assurances about minimal disruption to his land and lifestyle.

neighbors.name: Michael T. Ashcraft
neighbors.claims: Michael T. Ashcraft is a veteran law enforcement officer who served as an Orange County Deputy Sheriff (Undersheriff) through 2023 ([govsalaries.com](https://govsalaries.com/ashcraft-michael-t-182203941#:~:text=Michael%20Ashcraft%20T%20in%202023,the%20median%20salary%20in%20Orange)), reflecting strong ties to local authorities [GovSalaries](https://govsalaries.com/ashcraft-michael-t-182203941). He owns property in Deerpark, but no record of him speaking publicly on development or clean energy issues was found as of 2025 [Town of Deerpark](https://townofdeerparkny.gov/?p=10318).

approach_recommendations.engage: Have a respected law-enforcement peer or safety official reach out to Mr. Ashcraft. Emphasize the project’s thorough safety plans (traffic control, emergency access) and show respect for his public service while addressing any security or community order concerns he might raise.

neighbors.name: Robert Stormes
neighbors.claims: Robert Stormes is identified as a landowner in the Town of Deerpark’s assessment records [Town of Deerpark](https://townofdeerparkny.gov/?p=10318). He has no known involvement in local boards or public initiatives, and no statements regarding development projects have been documented under his name in local news or meetings [Town of Deerpark](https://townofdeerparkny.gov/?p=10318).

approach_recommendations.engage: Approach Mr. Stormes one-on-one with a neighborly tone. Discuss how the project will be screened and managed to protect his property’s privacy and value, and invite his feedback in an informal setting to build trust.

neighbors.name: Little Pond Land Holdco, LLC
neighbors.claims: Little Pond Land Holdco, LLC was registered in New York in December 2021, with Corporation Service Company (Albany) as its agent[Bloomberg LEI](https://lei.bloomberg.com/leis/view/254900O2MIO5HEV7V531)​. It is affiliated with the proposed Little Pond Solar project (20 MW) and shares a developer address in Santa Monica, California[NYSDEC Bulletin](https://dec.ny.gov/news/environmental-notice-bulletin/2024-11-27/completed-application/town-of-deerpark-little-pond-solar)​. The LLC itself holds the land for the solar development and has no other known business operations in the community[NYSDEC Bulletin](https://dec.ny.gov/news/environmental-notice-bulletin/2024-11-27/completed-application/town-of-deerpark-little-pond-solar)​. No separate political or charitable activities are evident for this entity (it serves the project’s corporate structure)[Bloomberg LEI](https://lei.bloomberg.com/leis/view/254900O2MIO5HEV7V531)​.
neighbors.influence_justification: Out-of-state solar developer affiliate; controls project land and capital, but minimal local social presence

approach_recommendations.engage: Coordinate closely with the project’s managing entity (developer); ensure alignment on development plans and leverage their interest in a smooth approval process. Engage their representatives as allies in community outreach since they benefit directly from the project’s success

neighbors.name: Cahoonzie Club, Inc.
neighbors.claims: Cahoonzie Club, Inc. is a longstanding private club owning extensive acreage in Deerpark, evidenced by the local road named after it (Cahoonzie Club Road)[Zillow](https://www.zillow.com/homedetails/17-Cahoonzie-Club-Rd-Sparrowbush-NY-12780/31814052_zpid/)​. It does not appear in public nonprofit registries, indicating it is a private membership or land-holding corporation rather than a charitable organization[TaxExemptWorld](https://www.taxexemptworld.com/organizations/orange-county-ny-new-york.asp)​. The club’s activities are largely private (likely hunting, fishing, or nature retreat use) and it has no online or commercial presence[TaxExemptWorld](https://www.taxexemptworld.com/organizations/orange-county-ny-new-york.asp)​. No record of political donations or advocacy from this entity or its officers was found in public databases, suggesting a low public profile[Orange County Nonprofits](https://www.taxexemptworld.com/organizations/orange-county-ny-new-york.asp)​.
neighbors.influence_justification: Private recreational group; holds large land but not publicly active or politically connected

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage the club’s leadership early through informal, respectful dialogue; emphasize measures to protect scenery and privacy. Address any environmental concerns with data and offer accommodations (screening, limited access) to maintain their use of the land

neighbors.name: Whitehead Lake Properties, LLC
neighbors.claims: Whitehead Lake Properties, LLC is an entity that holds multiple real estate parcels near Whitehead Lake/Whitehead Road in Deerpark[NYSDEC Bulletin](https://dec.ny.gov/news/environmental-notice-bulletin/2024-11-27/completed-application/town-of-deerpark-little-pond-solar)​. The LLC’s formation and ownership are not readily visible in state corporate filings, indicating it may be a small private investment vehicle (no separate business filings or website)[Orange County Parcel Information](https://propertydata.orangecountygov.com)​. Its name suggests a focus on property holding in the Whitehead Lake area, and no other business activities are noted aside from owning land. No liens, UCC filings, or court cases were found associated with this LLC in public records, implying a simple land-holding purpose with low external activity[Orange County Parcel Information](https://propertydata.orangecountygov.com)​.
neighbors.influence_justification: Local land investor with limited footprint; no known community role beyond owning parcels

approach_recommendations.engage: Identify the principal owner (via LLC registration) and open a discussion about mutually beneficial outcomes. Highlight how the proposed development could increase nearby land values or offer an exit strategy, and consider negotiating purchase or buffers to address their interests

neighbors.name: K G K International Inc
neighbors.claims: KGK International Inc is a U.S. subsidiary of a global industrial firm (Kanematsu KGK), established in 1981 to distribute industrial machinery and equipment[Bloomberg Markets](https://www.bloomberg.com/profile/company/1255885D:US)​. Its main operations are based in Illinois, and it has no known active facilities or workforce in Orange County, NY. The company does own a parcel of land in Deerpark (PIN 12-1-17), but there is no evidence of any structure or business use on that site (suggesting it remains vacant land). No local political contributions or community initiatives have been linked to KGK, reflecting that its presence in Deerpark is investment-oriented rather than community-driven[Bloomberg Markets](https://www.bloomberg.com/profile/company/1255885D:US)​.
neighbors.influence_justification: Non-local corporation; owns land but has no local operations or engagement

approach_recommendations.engage: Approach KGK via its corporate real estate or asset management division; propose mutually beneficial solutions such as purchasing their unused land or ensuring the project will not impede any future plans. Emphasize a cooperative stance to avoid conflict given their minimal local involvement

neighbors.name: 109 Whitehead Rd. Trust
neighbors.claims: 109 Whitehead Rd. Trust acquired the property at 109 Whitehead Road (Sparrowbush) in December 2021 for $37,500 [Zillow — other, retrieved 2025-12-20; "12/29/2021 Sold $37,500"](https://www.zillow.com/b/109-whitehead-rd-sparrow-bush-ny-97ybSR/). This trust is a private land-holding entity (not registered as an LLC or corporation) with no other parcels or business operations identified in public records [Orange County Real Property Tax Service — gov, retrieved 2025-12-20; "search for a property by Owner Name"](https://propertydata.orangecountygov.com/index.aspx?cty=33).
neighbors.influence_justification: Small single-parcel trust; no significant assets or known local connections

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage the trust’s representative with a straightforward purchase offer; likely profit-driven and willing to sell for a premium

neighbors.name: Ligarzewski Irrevocable Trust The Florence
neighbors.claims: The Florence Ligarzewski Irrevocable Trust is listed as owner of tax parcel 13-1-5.2 in Deerpark, Orange County [Orange County Real Property Tax Service — gov, retrieved 2025-12-20; "search for a property by Owner Name"](https://propertydata.orangecountygov.com/index.aspx?cty=33). This trust was likely established for estate planning purposes, holding family property under the name of Florence Ligarzewski rather than as a business asset [Calbo Law — other, retrieved 2025-12-20; "secure their assets for future generations"](https://calbolaw.com/how-irrevocable-trusts-shape-modern-estate-planning-strategies/). No evidence of any commercial activity or public political engagement is associated with this trust; it functions solely to hold and manage inherited real estate for the family’s benefit [Orange County Real Property Tax Service — gov, retrieved 2025-12-20; "search for a property by Owner Name"](https://propertydata.orangecountygov.com/index.aspx?cty=33).
neighbors.influence_justification: Longtime local family ownership; holds a significant land parcel but has limited public or economic role

approach_recommendations.engage: Initiate dialogue with the trust’s trustee or family representative; emphasize respectful development plans and consider proposing arrangements that honor the family’s land legacy (e.g., conservation easements or revenue sharing)

overview_summary: None of the identified neighbors have a clearly documented stance on the proposed development, with all five rated as "unknown" in their position. The Hartwood Club, a large private landowner, is the only neighbor with high community influence, whereas the remaining individual landowners are considered to have low direct influence locally. All five profiled neighbors have no clearly documented stance on development, with none found publicly supporting or opposing the project. Their community influence appears limited, as none hold local office or prominent civic positions. All five profiled neighbors have no clearly documented stance on the proposed development, so their positions remain unknown. None of them appear to hold significant influence in Deerpark’s civic or political life, as they are not public officials or prominent community figures. None of these five neighbors have a publicly documented stance for or against development, as no explicit statements were found. Most appear to be private landowners with little public profile or formal role in Deerpark. Only one neighbor hails from a historically prominent local family (suggesting moderate community influence), while the rest have low community influence. None of these Deerpark neighbors have an openly stated stance on the development. One neighbor is a high-profile county figure, but the other two appear to have low public profiles. No direct supporters or opponents have been identified among them. The neighboring landowners include a solar project holding company, a private recreational club, a land investment LLC, and an industrial corporation. Most lack deep local ties; their incentives vary from pursuing energy development (Little Pond) to preserving land (Cahoonzie Club) or maximizing land value (Whitehead Lake Properties, KGK). None appear to be community institutions or outspoken actors, suggesting limited coordinated opposition but potential individual concerns around land use and value. Two trusts hold the neighboring parcels instead of corporate entities. One is a small private trust likely created for a single property acquisition, indicating an individual investor with limited community clout. The other is an irrevocable family trust for a long-owned local property with strong sentimental value. Neither has organized backing; the family trust might oppose development to preserve its land, whereas the small trust is likely driven by profit.
